meanings.definition: A visit or appointment made by a service provider to a client's location.
meanings.sent1: The massage therapist scheduled an outcall to the customer's house.
meanings.sent2: The plumber offers outcall services for emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The outcall by the pizza delivery guy was faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her outcall to the doctor's office saved her time and hassle.
meanings.sent5: The outcall from the tech support team resolved the issue efficiently.

meanings.definition: To make a call or visit to a client's location for business purposes.
meanings.sent1: The sales representative will outcall the potential client tomorrow.
meanings.sent2: She outcalls her regular customers to maintain good relationships.
meanings.sent3: He outcalls his clients with a friendly tone to build rapport.
meanings.sent4: Outcalling clients is an essential part of the job for many professionals.
meanings.sent5: The company outcalls its clients to offer exclusive deals.
